title: Why A.I. Should Make Parents Rethink Posting Photos of Their Children Online
text: Artificial intelligence apps generating fake nudes, amid other privacy concerns, make “sharenting” far riskier than it was just a few years ago.

title: U.S. Government to Take Cut of Nvidia and AMD A.I. Chip Sales to China
text: In a highly unusual arrangement with President Trump, the companies are expected to kick 15 percent of what they make in China to the U.S. government.

title: Computer Science Grads Struggle to Find Jobs in the A.I. Age
text: As companies like Amazon and Microsoft lay off workers and embrace A.I. coding tools, computer science graduates say they’re struggling to land tech jobs.

title: AOL Will End Its Dial-Up Internet Service (Yes, It’s Still Operating)
text: The company said the service, synonymous with the early days of the internet, will be discontinued on Sept. 30.

title: Larry Ellison Wants to Do Good, Do Research and Make a Profit
text: Oracle’s co-founder and the world’s second-richest person pledges to concentrate his vast resources on his own research institute and for-profit ventures to address health, hunger and climate change.

title: The Hunt for a Lost Microscopic Art World
text: Decades ago, designers etched microscopic doodles onto silicon chips to leave their marks. Now, techno-archaeologists search for the tiny fossils.

title: President Trump Calls Intel C.E.O. a ‘Success’ After Meeting
text: Just days after calling for the resignation of Intel chief, Lip-Bu Tan, over his ties to China, Mr. Trump changed his tune.

title: Brazil Clamped Down on Big Tech. Trump’s Tariffs Could Change That.
text: With President Trump on their side, U.S. technology companies now have more leverage in Brazil, where they seek to influence new rules policing their platforms.

title: Who is Lip-Bu Tan, the Intel CEO in Trump’s Cross Hairs?
text: Lip-Bu Tan took the reins of Intel in March. On Thursday, President Trump called for his resignation.

title: America’s Clean Hydrogen Dreams Are Fading Again
text: The market for the clean-burning fuel remains nascent, costs are rising, and Congress just put a lucrative tax credit out of reach for many companies.

title: Ford Rejigs E.V. Plans After Suffering Billions in Losses
text: Ford, which once had a lead on other established automakers, said on Monday that it will use new materials and methods to lower the costs of electric vehicles.

title: I Never Understood Our Data-Saturated Life Until a Hurricane Shut It Down
text: When Helene disconnected my part of North Carolina for weeks, my neighbors and I had to relearn old ways of knowing what was happening — and what wasn’t.

title: What to Know About Instagram Map, Location Sharing and Privacy Concerns
text: The service rolled out this week, prompting confusion and safety concerns. Meta, which owns Instagram, said the feature was turned off unless users activated it.

title: How Older People Are Reaping Brain Benefits From New Tech
text: Overuse of digital gadgets harms teenagers, research suggests. But ubiquitous technology may be helping older Americans stay sharp.

title: Alexa Got an A.I. Brain Transplant. How Smart Is It Now?
text: It took Amazon several years to overcome technical hurdles as it remade its voice assistant with new artificial intelligence technology.
